original: Barkåkra, Krist. L, av tullvaktm. Johan B. o. Mathilda Korfitzon. G. 1. 13 rn. Gretchen Heyden, d. 20; 2. 26 m. med. lic. Gärda Petersson. — Mog:ex. i Hälsingborg 05, stud. v. Upps. univ. 05-06. Medarb. i Vårt Land 07-08, red:sekr. i Norrköp. Tidningar 08-18, andre red. o. polit. medarb. i Gbgs Morgonpost 18-21, polit. medarh. i Lunds Dagblad 19-20, andre red. i Norrköp. Tidningar 21, ansv. utg. sed. 22, huvudred, sed. 29. Ordf. i Sv. journ:fören. Öistg:krets v. dess stift. 18, i Östra Sv:es pressfören. 29-34, i Sv. tidn:utg:fören. Östg:krets sed. 46, led. av styr. f. Sv. tidn:utg:-fören. sed. 45, led. av stadsfullm. sed. 31, dess beredn:utsk. sed. 40, ordf. i stadsfullm. borgeri. grupp sed. 43, led. av fattigv :styr. sed. 34, dess v. ordf. sed. 36, led. av hälso- o. sjukvistyr., Norrköp. högerförb., centr :’styr. o. arb :utsk., huvudman i Norr köp. Sparbank. Medl. av Publ:-kl. o. Sv. tidn:-utg:fören. Stat&stip. i Tj^skl. o. Danm. 17. Sign: Didrik m. fl. RVO.
translated: Barkåkra, Krist. L, son of customs inspector Johan B. and Mathilda Korfitzon. Married 1st on the 13th of May to Gretchen Heyden, who passed away on the 20th; 2nd on the 26th of March to medical graduate Gärda Petersson. He completed his bachelor's degree in Hälsingborg in 1905 and studied at Uppsala University in 1905-06. He worked as a contributor for Vårt Land in 1907-08, as a secretary for the Norrköping Newspaper in 1908-1918, as a political editor for the Gothenburg Morning Post in 1918-1921, as a political contributor for Lund's Daily in 1919-1920, and as a second editor for the Norrköping Newspaper in 1921. He became the responsible editor in 1922 and the chief editor in 1929. He was the chairman of the Swedish Journalist Association Östergötland chapter since its foundation in 1918, chairman of the Eastern Sweden Press Association in 1929-1934, and a member of the board of the Swedish Newspaper Publishers Association since 1945. He was also a member of the city council since 1931, member of its preparatory committee since 1940, chairman of the citizens group since 1943, member and vice chairman of the board of the charity committee since 1934, member of the board of health and medical care in Norrköping, member of the right-wing party committee and the labor committee, and head of the Norrköping Savings Bank. He was a member of the Public Class and the Swedish Newspaper Publishers Association. He was also a State Statistician in Germany and Denmark in 1917. He went by the pen name Didrik and was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO) along with others.
